bank.title: BEAR Math Placement Exam Practice, Part 2 (Functions and Trigonometry)

outcome.title: Plane and Solid Geometry
outcome.description: Recall and use formulas for perimeter, area, surface area, and volume.

outcome.title: Global Properties of Functions' Graphs
outcome.description: Use the graph of a function to answer questions about its global properties, including its domain and range, solutions of inequalities, and intervals of increase/decrease.

outcome.title: Understanding Exponential Growth and Decay
outcome.description: Distinguish exponential from linear growth/decay, and make predictions using the base of an exponential relationship.

outcome.title: Intersection Points of Graphs
outcome.description: Determine the point(s) of intersection of two graphs, requiring solving equations up to quadratic in form.

outcome.title: Global Properties of Function Graphs
outcome.description: Connect global properties of functions, such as even/odd symmetry, with properties of their graphs.

outcome.title: Understanding Rational Exponents
outcome.description: Convert between fractional-exponent and radical expressions.

outcome.title: Graphs of Polynomial Functions
outcome.description: Match a polynomial function's expression with the shape of its graph, without the assistance of axes or coordinates.

outcome.title: Logarithmic Equations
outcome.description: Solve an equation given in logarithmic form, with a specified base.

outcome.title: Graphs of Exponential Functions
outcome.description: Match an exponential function's expression with the shape of its graph, without the assistance of axes or coordinates.

outcome.title: Solving Rational Equations
outcome.description: Use its factored form to solve an equation involving a rational expression.

outcome.title: Using Literal Equations
outcome.description: Use a given single-variable equation, without solving it, to predict the value of other expressions involving the same variable.

outcome.title: Coordinate Geometry in the xy-Plane
outcome.description: Use the distance formula to measure lengths of line segments between two given points on an xy coordinate system.

outcome.title: Using Function Notation
outcome.description: Evaluate a given function with a given algebraic expression as input.

outcome.title: Global Properties of Linear Graphs
outcome.description: Predict whether the graph of a linear equation is increasing, decreasing, horizontal, or vertical.

outcome.title: Local Properties of Functions' Graphs
outcome.description: Use the graph of a function to determine some of its local properties, including intercepts and other (x,y) coordinate data.

outcome.title: Transformations of Function Graphs
outcome.description: Connect the equation and the graph of a given transformed (shifted/scaled/reflected) function graph with that of its parent function.

outcome.title: Absolute-Value Equations and Inequalities
outcome.description: Solve an inequality involving absolute values, expressing the answer as a solved compound inequality.

outcome.title: Properties of Rational Functions
outcome.description: Use its formula to determine the domain and horizontal and vertical asymptotes of a given rational function.

outcome.title: Extreme Values of Functions
outcome.description: Use its graph to determine local and global minimum/maximum points and values of a given function.

outcome.title: Graphs of Trigonometric Functions
outcome.description: Match a given trigonometric parent function with its graph on a specified interval.

outcome.title: Basic Trigonometric Identities
outcome.description: Exchange one trigonometric function for another in an equivalent expression, using their definitions and/or the Pythagorean identities.

outcome.title: Reference Angles on the Unit Circle
outcome.description: Recall trigonometric ratios of special angles on the unit circle, without the use of a calculator.

outcome.title: Domains and Ranges of Trigonometric Functions
outcome.description: Identify undefined input and/or output values of basic trigonometric functions.

outcome.title: Trigonometric Expressions
outcome.description: Use their sine/cosine definitions to simplify products of expressions involving all six trigonometric ratios.
